groovyx.gaelyk.query
[Groovy] Class QueryBuilder

java.lang.Object
  groovyx.gaelyk.query.QueryBuilder

class QueryBuilder
extends Object

The query build is used to create a datastore Query or execute a PreparedQuery, from the datastore.query {} or datastore.execute {} calls.

Authors:
Guillaume Laforge
Since:
1.0

QueryBuilder ancestor(Key key)
Specify finding entities descending a certain ancestor Possible syntax: 

  ancestor someKeyVariable
Parameters:
key - the key of the ancestor
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

from

QueryBuilder from(String entityKind)
Defines the entity kind we want to retrieve. Possible syntax: 

  from persons
  from 'persons'
  from someStringVariable
Parameters:
entityKind - the kind of the entity we want to search for
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

from

QueryBuilder from(String entityKind, Class coercedTo)
Defines the entity kind we want to retrieve, and specifies that we want to coerce the Entity into a specific class. Possible syntax: 

  from persons as Person
  from 'persons' as Person
  from someStringVariable as SomeClass
Parameters:
entityKind - the entity kind
coercedTo - the class into which we want to coerce the entities
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

getProperty

def getProperty(String name)
Parameters:
name - the name of the property to be retrieved from within the closue passed to query/execute()
Returns:
the all, keys, single or count query type constants or a string representing the property

iterate

def iterate()
Returns:
the result of the execution of a prepared query in the form of an iterator

limit

QueryBuilder limit(int lim)
Defines a limit fetch option for the PreparedQuery Possible syntax: 

  limit 10
  offset 50 limit 10
Parameters:
lim - the limit
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

offset

QueryBuilder offset(int ofst)
Defines an offset fetch option for the PreparedQuery Possible syntax: 

  offset 10
  offset 50 limit 10
Parameters:
ofst - the offset
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

prefetchSize

QueryBuilder prefetchSize(int size)
Defines a prefetch size fetch option for the PreparedQuery Possible syntax: 

  offset 10
  offset 50 limit 10
Parameters:
size - the prefetch size
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

range

QueryBuilder range(IntRange range)
Defines a range, ie. an offset and limit fetch options for the PreparedQuery Possible syntax: 

  range 10..20
Parameters:
range - an int range
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

select

QueryBuilder select(QueryType qt)
Select all entity properties, keys only, a single entity, or the count of entities matching that query. By default, if the select clause is not used, the query builder assumes a select all. Possible syntax: 

  select all
  select keys
  select single
  select count
Parameters:
qt - the type of query
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

select

void select(Object qt)
throws:
QuerySyntaxException if a wrong parameter is passed to the select clause.

sort

SortClause sort(String direction)
Specify sorting on a property and its direction. Possible syntax: 

  sort asc by age
  sort desc by dateCreated
Parameters:
direction - asc or desc for ascending and descending sorting respectively
Returns:
a sort clause on which the by() method can be called

sort

void sort(Object direction)
throws:
QuerySyntaxException when a wrong direction is being used

startAt

QueryBuilder startAt(Cursor cursor)
Defines a start cursor fetch option for the PreparedQuery Possible syntax: 

  startAt someCursorVariable
Parameters:
cursor - the start cursor
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

startAt

QueryBuilder startAt(String cursorString)
Defines a start cursor fetch option for the PreparedQuery using a string representation of the cursor Possible syntax: 

  startAt cursorString
Parameters:
cursor - the start cursor in its string representation
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

where

QueryBuilder where(WhereClause clause)
Defines a where clause for comparing an entity property to another value. The left-hand-side of the comparison should be the column, and the right-hand-side the value to be compared against. The following operators are supported: <, <=, ==, >=, >, != and in Possible syntax: 

  where dateCreated > new Date() - 1
  where name == 'Guillaume'
  where numChildren in [0, 1]
  where color != 'red'
Parameters:
clause - the where clause
Returns:
the query builder for chaining calls

where

void where(Object clause)
throws:
QuerySyntaxException when something different than a where clause is given
